dialogue: Does the defense accept or challenge?
We accept him, Your Honor.
Good. Then please enter "Justin Kemp" as Juror #2.
Mr. Resnick. Your witness.
Mr. Reed, you hike those trails in the woods frequently, don't you?
All right, then. Now seems like a good time to break for the day.
Tomorrow, it's your turn up there.
Just remember what we talked about. Tell your story.
The defense calls James Sythe, Your Honor.
Do you swear to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help you God?
I move for a mistrial, Your Honor. He's a former COP. Who knows what ideas he's put in the jury's heads?
Failure to elicit his previous employment during voir dire is on you, Mr. Resnick.
It's misconduct!
Your Honor--
As for you two --
You violated your oath as jurors.
Your Honor, I would ask that a copy of these documents be made a part of the Court’s record for purposes of appeal. And I would again, move for a mistrail.
The documents will be marked as a Defendant’s exhibit. The motion for mistrial is denied, Mr. Resnick. Is that understood?
Yes, Your Honor.
All right. Then we're done here.
No, Your Honor.
Is you client good with this?
